intro: Xeraea oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed xeraea, is a unique member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly cultivated species.
